title: Creates the crime of tampering with electronic monitoring equipment
summary: Creates the crime of tampering with electronic monitoring equipment; such crime is a class A misdemeanor.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3357

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 25, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A. GABRYSZAK, PAULIN, BENEDETTO, GALEF -- Multi-
         Sponsored by -- M. of A.  McDONOUGH, PHEFFER, TITONE -- read once  and
         referred to the Committee on Codes

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the  penal law, in relation to creating the crime of
         tampering with electronic monitoring equipment

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. The penal law is amended by adding a new section 145.80 to
    2  read as follows:
    3  S 145.80 TAMPERING WITH ELECTRONIC MONITORING EQUIPMENT.
    4    1. FOR PURPOSES OF THIS  SECTION,  "ELECTRONIC  MONITORING  EQUIPMENT"
    5  MEANS  AN  INSTRUMENT  OR DEVICE UTILIZED IN ACCORDANCE WITH SUBDIVISION
    6  FOUR OF SECTION 65.10 OF THIS CHAPTER.
    7    2. A PERSON IS GUILTY OF TAMPERING WITH ELECTRONIC  MONITORING  EQUIP-
    8  MENT WHEN, HAVING NO RIGHT TO DO SO NOR ANY REASONABLE GROUND TO BELIEVE
    9  THAT  HE  OR SHE HAS SUCH RIGHT, HE OR SHE TAMPERS WITH ELECTRONIC MONI-
   10  TORING EQUIPMENT, OR DAMAGES OR OTHERWISE ALTERS SUCH  ELECTRONIC  MONI-
   11  TORING  EQUIPMENT  IN AN EFFORT TO INTERFERE WITH ANY SIGNAL, IMPULSE OR
   12  DATA BEING TRANSMITTED BY SUCH ELECTRONIC MONITORING EQUIPMENT.
   13    TAMPERING WITH ELECTRONIC MONITORING EQUIPMENT IS A CLASS A  MISDEMEA-
   14  NOR.
   15    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
   16  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07719-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to creating the crime of tampering with electronic monitoring equipment
